Reviews.Title: “fantastic value, great for visiting london”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: my husband and young child have just stayed at this hotel as a base to visiting london. we found it very convenient to access the centre of london- only 10 mins walk to the tube. there is a large supermarket nearby which was very helpful for us. the rooms were basic but clean, and we thought the hotel was excellent value for money. breakfast was cooked every morning a real bonus. we would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to friends already. thanks for everything

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: DublinDelboy
Reviews.Content: This so called Hotel has got to be the worst ever place I have ever had the misfortune to stay in.When we arrived we wre met by a disinterested & rude woman who could barely speak english.As a family of four with two young children we were given two rooms that were on different floors.We kindly asked if these rooms could be nearer each other or at least on the same floor but we this request was rudely given a no possible chance reply and we were then asked for a credit card payment before we we given the room keys.she couldnt even be bothered to show you to the rooms herself.The rooms were very poor quality,smelling of damp & missing furniture fittings,handles etc.The double room was really cramped & the shower was of little use.The noises coming from the other rooms once they turned on the water system was endless,either the shower or wash hand basins produced this whining gurgling sounds that were so annoying especially in the early morning.We were informed breakfast was only served between the hours of 7am -8.30 am,so much for a relaxing break!The first and only time we went down for breakfast was the following morning where we were seated at a table that was dirty,table clothes worn with holes and chipped plates & cups.The worst was yet to come as the full english was mostly a plate full of beans,bacon like rubber,one sausage & a dried up fried egg. This was accompanied by a pot of warm tea & wait for it mould ridden toast! We then ate breakfast for the rest of the week in the local village for obvious reasons. ThIs establishment is more of a hostel than Hotel,tradesmens vans & trucks fill up the small forecourt outside the place,obviously just using the place to sleep at during the contracts they have,probably at the olympic stadium site nearby. It has been given a two star rating by the AA but I doubt whether this was given recently and certainly not to the present owners.I suggest they revisit the premises asap to review this approval rating for their own credibility at least. So if you are either thinking of staying local to the South Woodford area for whatever reason & you happen to come across the Grove Hill Hotel I urge you to stay away & keep looking elsewhere,youll be glad you did,trust me.

Reviews.Title: “if your wanting value for money this is a great place”
Reviews.Author: Sarah503982
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here. Have to say that although initially the reception was a little frosty, due to the fact that our booking did not correspond with their listing, after alternative rooms were agreed (twins instead of doubles) they were very welcoming. The decor is slightly dated but very clean and had everything you needed. The breakfast was a full english, very nice and they did offer alternatives if you wanted something different. There's a good choice of shops/bars/restaurants within a 2 minute walk of the hotel and it's only a 5-10 minute walk from the tube station so perfect for anyone planning on spending their days in central London. I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: goowin
Reviews.Content: okay, so it is no 4 star hotel but what do you expect for such a low cost so close to London?? Stayed there for one night, as as spent most of our day in London we were just looking for somewhere to sleep. Bedroom was clean and bed comfy ( although cover was a little short), bathroom was clean ( although plug didn't fit the sink). Breakfast was good, and parking out side was a real bonus. They even allowed us to keep our car there both days so we could go into London again. very easy to get into London, just a 10 min walk from station. All in all it was fine and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A very, very basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ATJLancsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the twin bed room at the top of the house where the head room was very restricted. The only good things that could be said for the room was that it was clean and the bathroom had been refurbished. The new bath however was the smallest one I have ever seen and there wasn't a shower. We stayed two nights and had no change of towels or bed linen (we weren't asked or informed). The furniture in the room consisted of two single beds, one bedside cabinet and a very small built-in wardrobe made from unpainted MDF. Inviting, it was NOT! The carpets on the stairs were threadbare, there was thick dust on the door frames and finger marks around the door handles throughout the hotel. The breakfast was average, but with minimal choice. We should have stayed for a similar price at a nearby Priemier Inn - our mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Room clean if a little small, overall excellent value”
Reviews.Author: baysilverfox
Reviews.Content: Visiting London for Huddersfield Town v Leyton Orient. Looking for something cheap and cheerful to stay the night and this place fits the bill. No frills but clean room with ensuite, and good breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great service, what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: thedjs
Reviews.Content: My family wanted to go to London to see all the usual sights. We needed a good value hotel close to the underground. Grove Hill fitted the bill perfectly. It is only a maximum 10 minute walk from the tube at South Woodford. We had a quad room with 2 double beds and it was cleaned daily. The breakfast was fruit juice, coffee/tea, choice of cereals, lots of toast AND full cooked breakfast. I can't see how anyone can moan at the facilities when they get so much value , it is London after all. The staff were lovely and made us feel very welcome. If you are on a budget and yet still want to stay in London then this is the place for you. Thank you to the hotel for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: WBHull
Reviews.Content: My husband works in London and I go often with my 2 teenagers 15 and 18 and usually get a family room at a premier hotel chain. Went for the weekend to see a show and after consideration of it being Â£10 more for 2 singles and a double with bathroom, gave it a try. And will again. No its not the Hilton but its also not Â£400 a night. The rooms were clean and tidy with clean towels coffee and tea and biscuits. Breakfast was good with full English or cereal, egg on toast, they are very accomodating. The rooms were cleaned everyday. Staff were more than friendly. Area is nice and quiet 5 min walk to local supermarket and 10 min walk to tube station. My son left a ring in his room and they were waiting to clean it as we left and came running after him with his ring, now that does not happen very often.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel but London is great”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkRasher
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for late August but when arrived hotel did not have any knowledge of our booking even though we had confirmation so our initial impression of this hotel was tainted! Bad points 1] hotel looked run down from outside with tiles fallen off front step and not replaced 2] our room had no blind because a previous visitor had broken it and although we were told it would be fixed we had to make do with a bedsheet taped to the window 3] my father-in-law's single room was not ensuite although that's what we had booked and the door would not lock, this was fixed for our second night. Good points 1] the hotel had a couple of rooms so we were able to stay 2] we got our booking fee back from Travelstay.com with no quibble after I phoned them on our return home but not the booking + credit card fee which was charged even though they failed to make the booking (according to the hotel they said this had happened before!) 3] pleasant location was quiet and only short walk to nearest tube 4] plenty of shops, bars and good pub 4] breakfast ok

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tatianauk2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a B&B from Friday - Monday. Some advices: 1. ring before you arrive to double check if you have your room, as ours was on the system but not in their guest book they are working from!!! So if we wouldn't ring I dont know if we would have a room. 2. When we arrived the landlady and landlord are OK, but not very welcoming - that was our feeling as we stayed in few B&B before and compared. 3. Room was very nice, new and clean a bit small but for us two it was enough as we were only sleeping there. Room had a private bathroom VERY BIG ADVANTAGE!!! As there were rooms with sharing bathroom and WC ... looked inside - not nice very old tiles. But our room was perfect with private bathroom - request when you doing your booking. 3. Provided tea and coffee at room, the kettle didnt work properly but we figured out to make it work :-) not big issue. 4. Breakfast room - very small if you have lots of people staying over, but go early and you will be sorted :-) 5. Breakfast - they put it as a full breakfast but to my opinion it wasn't that great( 1 egg, 1 sausage, 1 warm tomatoe, 2-3 slices bacon, beans) - not a great deal but OK, also cereals and jams. 6.Every room had a old doors and I have to tried to figured out how to lock it but managed to do it - they should update it a little bit also the carpets were a little to much for me :-) 6. Guests in other rooms a bit noisy - no respect that others might sleep but when you sharing a bathroom no wonder :-) 7. Hotel is in a very nice area, we haven't been scared to walk around. Lots of restaurants and take aways around. We have also found a shortcut throught the Sainsbury to go to the Tube Station. The street where the hotel is situated is very nice and quiet, that is what you need. I would recommend this hotel as it is not bad and worth of money and in a nice area. Of course need a little bit of improvment but it's ok for money. If you are posh don't look for cheap B&B if you want to just sleep and get into the London it is a perfect location and hotel for you. Its on central line too, so to get to London takes max. 30 minutes. My review is very honest, because I would like to help others to choose what they want, but go for a private bathroom is nothing worse to share it :-) We are giving a rate 4/5 as I mention before there are things which could improve but I hope they will because its a nice B&B to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Threatened with mugging, robbed of my deposit...worst hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: hikmatyar
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here in July, and was denied entry, told "I have a terrible attitude" and threatened with a mugging on my way out. The only plausible reason I can think of for being given this treatment was my ethnicity. Stay away from this place - you will be all the more happier and safer for it.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: violet59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for night and that was too long. We were told the room was ensuite it was not, it had a toilet and sink. The carpets were all stained, the furniture looked like it came out of the ark. The only good thing I could say that the bed linen was clean. This hotel needs complete modernisation. Breakfast was included in the price but we did not fancy eating there. We only seen one of the staff and then is when we booked in.

HotelInfo.Name: Grove Hill Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 38 Grove Hill | South Woodford, London E18 2JG, England
